title: Ruth Wilson wins the TV Icon Award at Harper's Bazaar Women of The Year
text:
She has had several successful roles in the likes of Luther, The Affair and Mrs. Wilson.

So it came as no surprise that Ruth Wilson was honoured with the TV Icon Award at Harper's Bazaar Women of The Year Awards at Claridge's Hotel in London on Tuesday.

The actress, 37, wowed at the event in a stunning silver metallic floral patterned gown with a plunging neckline and ruffled sleeves.

What a woman! Ruth Wilson was honoured with the TV Icon Award at Harper's Bazaar Women of The Year Awards at Claridge's Hotel in London on Tuesday

Adding some glamorous accessories, Ruth opted for a pair of jaw-dropping diamond statement earrings and a matching bracelet.

The television star styled her brunette locks into a sleek straightened sweptback hairdo, she added a slick of glamorous make-up.

Ruth led a slew of stars in attendance at the awards bash including Cate Blanchett, Helena Bonham-Carter, Alexa Chung and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley.

The star's appearance comes ahead of the debut of her new HBO/BBC series His Dark Materials.

Wow: The actress, 37, wowed at the event in a stunning silver metallic floral patterned gown with a plunging neckline and ruffled sleeves

Award: Adding some glamorous accessories, Ruth opted for a pair of jaw-dropping diamond statement earrings and a matching bracelet (pictured with novelist Sarah Waters)

His Dark Materials, which follows the novel series of the same name made up of Northern Lights, The Subtle Knife and The Amber Spyglass, will star Dafne Keen as heroine Lyra.

Along with Ruth, who plays Marisa Coulter, Dafne will also be joined by James McAvoy and Lin-Manuel Miranda.

The series, which is set on a parallel Earth, focuses on humans whose souls exist within creatures known as daemons and take the form of animals.

It will follow the heroine Lyra as she hunts for answers after her friends disappear following encounters with beings known as The Gobblers.

Glamorous: The television star styled her brunette locks into a sleek straightened sweptback hairdo, she added a slick of glamorous make-up

Amid her search for the truth, Lyra is taken into the care of Marisa Coulter who is linked to her uncle, Lord Asriel [James McAvoy].

After being gifted a device called the Alethiometer by the Master of Jordan College where she lives, Lyra begins her hunt for her friends.

Fearing Dafne would look too old if they waited for feedback on the first instalment before recording the second, the BBC took a risk and started filming the next series straight away.

Star-studded: Ruth led a slew of stars in attendance at the awards bash including Cate Blanchett, Helena Bonham-Carter, Alexa Chung and Rosie Huntington-Whiteley

While the bold move may seem risky, early viewings have indicated that fans will be satisfied.

Although the adaptation is understood to have a lower budget than that of Netflix's $7million-per-episode The Crown, it will exceed any other previous BBC drama.

The cost is being shared by the US network HBO, which will distribute the adaptation internationally.

His Dark Materials is set to air on BBC One on 3 November 2019.
